comments: Online courses, especially with group projects are tough to organize. This teacher was out of the country, or out of town, several times during the semester. She claimed to have a quick e-mail turnaround. False. In our last class, she claimed she had sufficiently answered our questions. False. She claimed she was clear. False. Avoid.

Professor is disorganized and unclear. Grades are very subjective. Creates assignments that have nothing to do with the reading. Assigned a textbook that was a version too old and then we never used it. Did an assignment that I spent hours searching the internet for and she wasn\'t satisfied but wouldn\'t let us use other sources. Stay away!

this class was a total mess. very disorganized, very unclear. very late and snippy responses to questions (if they responded at all). no idea what was expected of us or what we were supposed to do. LOTS of work, very time consuming, but an easy A if you put in the time. don\'t take it if you have a choice. actually just don\'t go to pace!

I had Dr. Sonenberg for both NUR 110 and 220 and she was great. I\'m not going to lie, her exams are a little tricky, but in all fairness she does her statistical analysis and takes out questions she felt were unfair to the students. Love her, she is very professional and intelligent.

you have to work for your grade and read your book!!!! her powerpoints alone is not going to get you an A...however, after leaving her class you will know all you have to...make sure you read her ?\'s carefully!!! and ask yourself what is she trying to ask you and identify the MAIN PT!!!!! if you fo all of this you will be fine
Sonenberg is really smart but one thing u need to know before going to her class is that she is a hard grader. I work hard on her assignment and non of them got above an 70
Professor Sonenberg is so smart. She knows what she is teaching and extremely nice.
